{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mass Drug Administration (MDA) is a strategy used to control or eliminate certain Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs). It involves treating everyone in a community or a defined geographical area with a particular drug or combination of drugs. Lymphatic Filariasis, Worm Infestation, and Scabies are all NTDs that can be controlled or eliminated through MDA. However, Vitamin A deficiency is a nutritional problem, not a disease caused by a specific pathogen. Therefore, while MDA can be used to distribute Vitamin A supplements, it is not primarily used to control or eliminate Vitamin A deficiency.", "answer_choice": "B. Vit A Deficiency"}
